sentences.cn: 奶奶好不容易地摇摇晃晃地上了楼.

sentences.en: He gave a stagger on hearing the news.
sentences.cn: 他听到这一消息两腿摇晃起来.
他好不容易才蹒跚着走回家。

sentences.en: He persisted in his headlong stagger, guided on by Herb.
sentences.cn: 他一定要往前踉跄地走, 赫伯给他带路.

sentences.en: He picked up the heavy suitcase and set off with a stagger.
sentences.cn: 他提起沉重的箱子,打个趔趄就走了.

sentences.en: His resolution had begun to stagger.
I saw the injured man stagger away like someone drunk.
sentences.cn: 我看见那个受伤的人像个喝醉了酒的人似的摇摇晃晃地走了.

sentences.en: I was so tired I could hardly stagger to my feet.
sentences.cn: 我太累了,摇摇晃晃的都站不稳了.

sentences.en: Please kindly stagger three public holidays of 1 May.
sentences.cn: 请错开五一的三天长假.

sentences.en: Stagger and stumble suggest unsteady or uncontrolledmovement.
sentences.cn: stagger和stumble均指不稳的或身不由己的动作.

sentences.en: Stagger the seats so that everyone can see.
sentences.cn: 把座位错开,大家就都看得见了.

sentences.en: The old man staggered drunkenly to his feet.
sentences.cn: 老汉醉醺醺地踉跄着站了起来。

sentences.en: The school was so crowded they had to stagger the classes.
sentences.cn: 这所学校如此拥挤,他们只得错开上课.

sentences.en: Truman allowed him to stagger on for nearly another two years.
sentences.cn: 杜鲁门允许他又硬撑了近两年。

sentences.en: We can't hold the two meetings at the same time; we must stagger them.
sentences.cn: 这两个会不能同时开, 得错一下.

sentences.en: When one team was relieved by another, they would stagger alongside the guns.
sentences.cn: 轮到一队人换下休息了, 他们便拖着踉跄的脚步,跟在大炮旁边走.

sentences.en: Young men toil at the millstones; boys stagger under loads of wood.
sentences.cn: 少年人扛磨石, 孩童背木柴,都绊跌了.

words.tran_cn: 蹒跚的；另人惊愕的；犹豫的

trans.tran_en: an unsteady movement of someone who is having difficulty in walking
to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over

trans.tran_cn: 使蹒跚，使摇摆，使犹豫，错开时间，使吃惊
trans.tran_en: to make someone feel very surprised or shocked
